title: Images & Links
info: Hyperlinks are important components of almost all webpages. Hyperlinks allow web-developers to easily direct readers to relevant content, elsewhere on the web. By clicking on a link, web page readers can navigate from one web page to another.
HTML links are clickable hyperlinks. When a user clicks on one HTML link they are auto-directed to the linked content (either on the same web page or on a different web page).

To define a hyperlink, use the HTML tag. This line of text demonstrates the proper syntax. link text Focus, for a moment, on the href attribute. This indicates a link’s destination. The link text portion is what is visible to a web page reader. When the reader clicks on the link text, they will be redirected to the associated URL address.
Images can be used in HTML to display pictures and spice up your site. Create an image using the tag. Notice the 'src' portion. This src value gives the image its source url.
